bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, September 7, 1921

div1.p: Read reports on new yellow fever cases in Central America, conditions in various areas in Mexico, and intensive control measures to reduce incidence of infection.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, September 7, 1921

September 7, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
In order to keep the members of the Yellow Fever Council
in touch with yellow fever conditions, I am writing to inform you
that during the last two weeks of August cases of yellow fever
were reported from Belize, British Honduras, and from Manzanillo,
Mexico. With respect to British Honduras, the Governor informed us
by cable that he had every hope of preventing the outbreak from
becoming epidemic.

Concerning the west coast of Mexico, General Lyster has
today advised us by wire that he finds no yellow fever at present
in Mazatlan. He was leaving for Manzanillo and plans to institute
a vigorous campaign in that area if conditions require it. In
general, the situation in Mexico is satisfactory. Yucatan has re-
mained free this year as far as we know. Both Tampico and Vera
Cruz have remained free; in Tuxpam there have been a few cases, all
imported with one or two exceptions. The southern area in the
state of Vera Cruz has shown several small scattered foci which
it is hoped are now under control. Intensive work is under way.

The epidemic in Peru has apparently been controlled.
Doctor Henry R. Carter.
September 7, 1921.
2.
Doctor Hanson cabled us under date of July 29 that there was then no
known case in the country. Control measures are to be continued.

Doctor Joseph H. White has made two careful investigations of
conditions in Guayaquil and a recent cable from him indicates that he is
satisfied that the situation there is safe.

As there are any developments in the situation, from time to
time, we shall keep you advised. It is to be expected that sporadic cases
will appear. The encouraging factor is the quick reduction in the
incidence of infection as soon as intensive control measures are instituted,
as has happened, for example, in Peru.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read
Assistant Secretary. Doctor Henry R. Carter,
New Glasgow Post Office,
Amherst County,
Virginia.
